_desc.NAICS_DESCRIPTION: Other Chemical and Allied Products Merchant Wholesalers
Other Chemical and Allied Products Merchant Wholesalers

_exec_summary.SummaryText:
Executive Summary

COMPANY OVERVIEW

Univar USA Inc. is a wholesale chemical distributor serving a number of U.S. industries.  Univar supplies the food industry, chemical compounders, pharmaceuticals, mining, forest products, oil & gas producers, electronics, coatings and many other key industries with chemical raw materials required to produce or refine products used in numerous end-use markets.

Univar USA Inc. is a member of the National Association of Chemical Distributors (NACD) and complies with the Responsible Distribution Process (RDP), an environmental, health and safety improvement initiative.

Some products stored and handled by Univar are subject to EPA's Risk Management Program rule (40CFR Part 68).  A key requirement of this rule is the preparation and submission of an RMP Plan, contained herein.  The contents of the RMP Plan are prescribed by EPA, including this Executive Summary.

CORPORATE PREVENTION AND EMERGENCY RESPONSE APPROACH

1.  Prevention Program

Univar USA Inc. Inc. has documented its Prevention Program in its Process Safety Management Manual.  Briefly, this program includes provisions and requirements for:

* Process Safety Information
* Process Hazard Analysis
* Operating Procedures
* Training
* Mechanical Integrity
* Management of Change
* Pre-Startup Review
* Compliance Audits
* Incident Investigation
* Employee Participation
* Hot Work permits
* Contractors

2. Emergency Response Approach

Univar USA Inc. has an Emergency Contingency Plan in-place.  This Plan is shared with local emergency responders who have access to Univar facility personnel.  Univar responds to minor incidents but will call in professional emergency responders in the event of all other incidents.

Univar invites and encourages local emergency responders such as the fire department to visit and familiarize themselves with our products and facilities.  Joint emergency exercises are conducted when possible.

STATIONARY SOURCE AND REGULATED SUBSTANCES HANDLED

The In

dianapolis site stores, handles and delivers a variety of hazardous and non-hazardous chemical products to wholesale customers and municipalities in Indiana, Ohio and Kentucky.  Aqua ammonia, also know as ammonia water solution, is handled at inventory levels above the RMP planning thresholds.  The product is received in bulk and stored in a 10,000-gallon aboveground storage tank.  It is packaged into drums and intermediate bulk containers and moved to the warehouse storage location for distribution to industrial users.  The typical inventory of aqua ammonia at the site is 50,000 pounds.


GENERAL PREVENTION PROGRAM AND CHEMICAL SPECIFIC PREVENTION STEPS

As outlined previously, Univar USA Inc. has a Process Safety Management program in place and utilizes this program to meet the prevention program requirements under RMP.

Chemical specific prevention steps include the following:
1. The maintenance of minimal practical inventories.
2. Employee training and operating procedures.
3. Employee release detection and mitigation activities.
4. Equipment and containers designed to meet appropriate regulatory guidelines.

ACCIDENT HISTORY

The Indianapolis site has not experienced any accidents as specified in 40 CFR Part 68 related to the bulk or containerized storage of aqua ammonia in the previous 5 years.

EMERGENCY RESPONSE PROGRAM

An emergency contingency plan has been prepared and made available to local emergency response agencies. The plan includes all aspects of emergency response including adequate first aid and medical treatment, evacuations, notification of local emergency response agencies and the public, as well as post-incident decontamination of affected areas.

To ensure proper functioning, our emergency response equipment is regularly inspected and serviced.  In addition, the plan is promptly updated to reflect any pertinent changes taking place within our processes that would require a modified emergency response.
